title: NLCS MVP Howie Kendrick misses Nationals workout due to family emergency
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: The Nationals are going to their first ever World Series and in the process had one of most historic turnarounds we've ever seen in baseball. USA TODAY

The Washington Nationals worked out Friday in advance of the World Series, but were without the National League Championship Series MVP.

Howie Kendrick was missing because of a family emergency, but Nationals manager Dave Martinez said he will be back soon and expects him to be ready for the start of the World Series, which begins Tuesday in either Houston or New York.

Kendrick has been clutch this postseason for the Nationals. He went 5-for-15 with four doubles and four RBI in the NLCS and slugged a 10th-inning grand slam in the decisive fifth game against the Los Angeles Dodgers in the NLDS.

Howie Kendrick holds the NLCS MVP trophy. (Photo: Geoff Burke, USA TODAY Sports)

At 36 years old, the 14-year veteran led the team with a .344 batting average during the regular season while playing first, second and third base.

"I can truly say this is the best time of my career," said Kendrick when he received the MVP award, "the best moment of my career this year."

description: NLCS MVP Howie Kendrick missed Friday's workout with the Nationals, but manager Dave Martinez said he’ll be back in time for the World Series.
